title: Sea Bass with Castelluccio Lentils - Spigola con lenticchie di Castelluccio

ingredients.content: 1 lemon, thin peelings of skin and juice
50 g sun-dried tomatoes in oil, drained
45 g extra virgin olive oil, plus extra for greasing
1 Tbsp extra virgin olive oil, plus extra for drizzling

preparations.content: Soak lentils in a bowl of cold water for 30 minutes. Meanwhile, prepare topping.
Place garlic, lemon peel and chilli in mixing bowl then grate <b>3 sec/speed 8<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add parsley, basil, mint, sun-dried tomatoes, capers, oil and lemon juice then chop <b>Turbo/2 sec/1 time<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then chop again <b>Turbo/2 sec/1 time<b>.

Arrange sea bass fillets, skin side down, in greased Varoma dish and tray, leaving some holes uncovered for steam to circulate. Spread topping evenly over fish, then cover with Varoma lid and set aside.
Drain soaked lentils then place in mixing bowl. Add water and stock cube then cook <b>16 min/100°C//speed 1<b>.
Place covered Varoma into position then steam above lentils <b>6-10 min/Varoma//speed 1<b> until fish and lentils are cooked.

Drain cooked lentils through simmering basket then place in a bowl. Stir through 1 Tbsp oil and 1 Tbsp lemon juice then season with salt and pepper. Serve lentils scattered over a plate with sea bass on top, drizzled with extra oil.
